result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Curtis Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid Restitution - Civil Judgment - Reduced by any payment made since restitution order.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid in full no later than July 1, 2016.    In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is prohibited from having any contact whatsoever with the premises of the Plainfield Dollar General Store and/or Dustin R. Ludtke.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Curtis Wilson
Current: 500 N Schmidt Rd, c/o Washington Co Jail, West Bend, WI 53095 United States  (Effective: 02-25-2016)
Prior: W12623 Beechnut Ave, Hancock, WI 54943

15CM-396 and SEHR Files 14CM-393 and 14CM-452 - All 3 Cases Called @ 11:15 AM: Defendant Joshua Curtis Wilson in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint global resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CM-396:  Plea Ct 1:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Outright dismissal of repeater enhancer.  Ct 2 DRI.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  No factual corrections offered.  14CM-452 Ct 1:  264 days WCJ with TS credit of 198 days, GT and Huber - constitutes Times Served SEH.  Court Costs reimposed - 60 DTP or PP.  14CM-393:  90 Days WCJ as to Ct 1 - 90 days TS credit - concurrent to 14CM452 sentence.  Court Costs reimposed - 60 DTP or PP.  15CM-396 - Ct 1 - 6 mos WCJ (2 days TS credit, GT and Huber if revoked) - I/S - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  Rest of $26.00 - to be PIF no later than 7/1/2016 (Release date 5/1/16); No contact with Plainfield Dollar General Store; No contact with Dustin Ludtke; Court Costs plus DNA surcharge.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
from DE requesting a signature bond and hearing be scheduled - VA scheduled to coincide w/ SEHR

11:50 am cases called. Attorney Alex E. Johnson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Johnson regarding defendant and lack of contact. Statement by ADA Anderson-discussion with Agent regarding release from WCJ on sanctions-apprehension request through P & P. Court authorizes a warrant-State of Wisconsin.
by USPS - No Mail Receptacle - Unable to Forward
Amended Restitution Summary - $26 (Added co-defendant Dustin Ludtke)
Resitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $26.00

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Def found eligible yesterday  with counsel to be appointed.  It is believed that Def is currently in WCJ.  Clerk confirmed he is in WCJ with release date of 11/27/2015.  STC rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 11:40 am.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 1:03 p.m. Defendant Joshua Curtis Wilson in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi. Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson - DE is on PO Hold, requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $2000 Sig Bond. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:20 am.
